com.pump.audio

Class AudioPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.audio.AudioPlayer

  • public class AudioPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    An object that manages playing back a resource. This offers the ability to play and pause, and adds listeners (either in real-time or at fixed polling intervals).

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • playAudioStream

        public static javax.sound.sampled.SourceDataLine playAudioStream(javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream stream)
                                                          throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException,
                                                                 javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException
        Plays audio from the given audio input stream on a separate thread.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException - if a line is unavailable.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this AudioPlayer doesn't support playing the stream argument

      • playAudioStream

        public static javax.sound.sampled.SourceDataLine playAudioStream(javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream stream,
                                                                 AudioPlayer.StartTime startTime,
                                                                 AudioPlayer.Listener listener,
                                                                 Cancellable cancellable,
                                                                 boolean blocking)
                                                          throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException,
                                                                 javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException
        Plays audio from the given audio input stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - the AudioInputStream to play.
        startTime - the time to skip to when playing starts. A value of zero means this plays from the beginning, 1 means it skips one second, etc.
        listener - an optional Listener to update.
        cancellable - an optional Cancellable to consult.
        blocking - whether this call is blocking or not.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException - if a line is unavailable.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this static method doesn't support playing the stream argument

      • addEDTListener

        public void addEDTListener(AudioPlayer.Listener l,
                           int updateInterval)
        This listener will receive coalesced events at a given interval on the event dispatch thread. This will in no way impact audio playback.
        Parameters:
        l - the listener to add.
        updateInterval - the number of milliseconds between possible events.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(AudioPlayer.Listener l)
        This listener will be updated in real-time, in the thread that is processing the audio. If this method is expensive: sound playback will be choppy as we wait for this listener to finish.

      • removeListener

        public boolean removeListener(AudioPlayer.Listener l)
        Remove a listener previously added by calling addListener().
        Parameters:
        l - the listener to remove.
        Returns:
        true if this listener was removed.

      • removeEDTListener

        public boolean removeEDTListener(AudioPlayer.Listener l)
        Remove a listener previously added by calling addEDTListener().
        Parameters:
        l - the listener to remove.
        Returns:
        true if this listener was removed.
